headlines: Musk's Twitter bid probably not good for me: Teenager who tracked his jet
text: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracked Elon Musk's private jet, reacted to Musk's Twitter offer, saying, "Oh no. Probably good for Twitter but probably not me lol." "I mean if he really wanted to then he could shut me down," Sweeney told Business Insider. Earlier, Sweeney asked TED Head Chris Anderson to ask Musk what made him buy Twitter stock.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk asks Twitter users if taking Twitter private should be up to shareholders
text: World's richest man Elon Musk has started a poll on Twitter asking users whether the decision to take Twitter private should be up to the company's shareholders. "Taking Twitter private at $54.20 should be up to shareholders, not the board," the poll reads. Musk has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, saying it is his "best and final offer".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk offered to buy my firm too: Journalist while sharing his experience
text: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, journalist Conrad Quilty-Harper spoke about the time when Musk offered to buy the science magazine he worked for in 2019. While Musk didn’t acquire the company, Conrad shared aspects such as trusting your social media manager, auditing the Twitter following and interaction with Musk, etc, as the takeaways from the incident.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter weighs 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Musk from raising stake: Report
text: Twitter's board is considering adopting a 'poison pill' strategy to prevent Elon Musk from raising his stake in the company significantly, Bloomberg reported. The strategy allows existing shareholders to buy more shares at a discount, effectively diluting the hostile party's stake. In a TED interview, Musk said "there's a plan B" if Twitter rejects his offer to buy the company.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk can buy Sri Lanka, call himself Ceylon Musk: Snapdeal CEO shares viral text
text: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl took to Twitter to share a viral WhatsApp forward after Elon Musk offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion. "He can buy [Sri Lanka's debt] and call himself Ceylon Musk," Bahl said. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s and recently declared it is defaulting on its $51 billion external debt.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: This is not a threat: Elon Musk in his offer to buy Twitter
text: Elon Musk, in his offer to buy Twitter, said, "If the deal...doesn't work...given that I don't have confidence in management nor do I believe I can drive necessary change in public market...I'd need to reconsider my position as a shareholder." He added, "This isn't a threat, it's simply not a good investment without the changes that need to be made."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Egypt has approved India as wheat supplier: Piyush Goyal
text: World's top wheat importer Egypt has approved India as a wheat supplier, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Friday. The development comes amid a sharp decline in availability of wheat in global markets due to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, who are both major wheat exporters. Egypt is looking to import 1 million tonne of wheat from India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Air India starts restoring salaries, allowances to pre-pandemic levels
text:
With the aviation sector recovering due to the decline in COVID-19 cases, Air India is restoring salaries and various other allowances of its employees in a phased manner to pre-pandemic levels. 
As per Air India’s document, for the cabin crew and pilots, the flying allowance, special pay and wide-body allowance will be restored to pre-pandemic levels starting April 1.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Germany seizes world's largest superyacht 'Dilbar' owned by Russian oligarch
text: The world's largest superyacht, 'Dilbar', owned by Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov, has been officially seized by Germany as part of its sanctions against Moscow over the invasion of Ukraine. With two helipads and the largest indoor pool ever installed on a yacht, 'Dilbar' is worth $600 million and it costs $60 million per year to maintain it.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Senco Gold files draft papers for ₹525 crore IPO
text: Jewellery retailer Senco Gold and Diamonds has filed draft papers with the SEBI to raise ₹525 crore through an IPO. The offer comprises fresh issue of equity shares of up to ₹325 crore and an offer for sale of shares worth ₹200 crore. Senco plans to use net proceeds from IPO towards funding working capital requirements and general corporate purposes.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Will be interesting to see how Musk's Twitter offer evolves: Amazon CEO
text: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in an interview discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy Twitter said the news is "very interesting", adding, "We all use Twitter...to some degree...It'll be interesting to see how it evolves." On being asked if Musk is ultimately going to buy Twitter, Jassy said, "I don't know. That's, that's the rumour."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: My conclusion, Musk is f****** with SEC: Cuban on his Twitter bid
text: US billionaire investor Mark Cuban while discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter bid, said, "My conclusion, Elon Musk is f****** with...SEC." "His filing with the SEC allows him to say he wants to take a company private for $54.20," Cuban wrote, comparing the bid to Musk's tweet about taking Tesla private at $420 that landed him in trouble with SEC.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon Musk is winning against GM, Ford, Toyota: Warren Buffett
text: Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett in an interview with Charlie Rose said Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "winning" against his competitors like GM, Ford and Toyota. He said all the firms against Musk have "got all the stuff" and Musk has "got an idea". "And he's winning. That's America. You can't dream it up. It's astounding," Buffett added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon is distracted, he's got a lot going on: Tesla investor exec
text: Amid the ongoing news surrounding Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion offer to buy Twitter, Tesla investor Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster said, "Elon is distracted. He's got a lot of things going on. He's involved in a lot of different endeavours." "This is a one to three months headwind to Tesla's stock," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Must be careful of EV push, it raises dependency on few nations: BMW
text: BMW CEO Oliver Zipse warned firms of the EV push, adding there was still a market for combustion engine cars. "When you look at the technology coming out, the EV push, we must be careful because at the same time, you increase dependency on very few countries," Zipse said. He highlighted that China mostly controls battery raw materials' supply.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Delhi govt to form panel to consider revision of auto & taxi fares
text: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot has announced the formation of a committee to consider the revision of auto and taxi fares. Earlier, auto, taxi and cab drivers' associations warned the authorities to go on a strike from Monday if their demand for subsidy on gas prices wasn't met. Notably, CNG price was hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi yesterday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Bank of India files for insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
text: Bank of India on Thursday filed a petition with the National Company Law Tribunal to initiate insolvency proceedings against Future Retail for non-payment of dues. This comes amid an ongoing legal battle between Future Retail and Amazon over the former's ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance Industries. "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us," Future Retail had said earlier.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: N Chandrasekaran implements management reshuffle at Air India
text: After the recent acquisition of Air India by Tata Group, Air India and Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran has conducted a major reshuffle in the airline's senior management. Veteran Meenakshi Mallik has been replaced by Nipun Aggarwal as the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) and Suresh Dutt Tripathi will succeed Air India's Amrita Sharan as the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO).
author: Shambhavi Mehrotra

headlines: Elon Musk offers to buy Twitter for $43 billion
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest man, Elon Musk, has offered to buy micro-blogging platform Twitter for $43 billion, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Musk's offer price of $54.20 per share represents a 38% premium to the closing price of Twitter's stock on April 1, Reuters said. Musk, with an over 9% Twitter stake, is the platform's biggest shareholder.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: We have no work with any Russian client today: Infosys
text: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh, while announcing Infosys Q4 results, said, "We have no work with any Russian client today and we have no plans for any work with any Russian client going ahead." He added, "The work we do is for a few of our global clients that have operations in Russia. We have less than 100 employees in Russia."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Infosys hired 85,000 freshers last year, to add over 50,000 freshers this year
text: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy said, "In the last year (FY22) we hired 85,000 freshers, both globally and in India." He added, "We are planning to do (hire) upwards of 50,000 freshers at least this year (FY23)...and we will see how that plays out...but that's just initial." He also said, "The good news is...we've mastered the art of off-campus recruitment."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter has extraordinary potential, I'll unlock it: Musk on offer to buy Twitter
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion, in a letter to Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor said, "Twitter has extraordinary potential. I will unlock it." Musk, Twitter's biggest shareholder, added, "Since making my investment (in Twitter) I now realise the company will neither thrive nor serve this societal imperative in its current form."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I don't have confidence in management: Musk to Twitter Chairman
text: World's richest person Elon Musk said he doesn't have confidence in management while offering to buy Twitter for $43 billion, a regulatory filing revealed. "I am not playing the back-and-forth game...It's a high price and your shareholders will love it," Musk told Twitter Chairman Bret Taylor. Musk added, "I have decided I want to acquire Twitter and take it private."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Infosys has a three-phase plan for employees' return to offices: CFO
text: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy explained employees' three-phased return to work plan, saying, "In the first phase, we're encouraging people in their home locations...in the DCs (Development Centres) where they are...to come at least twice a week." He said, "Phase two is encouraging people outside DC towns to make preparations for return." He called "looking at hybrid work" the third phase.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: My best and final offer: Musk on $43 billion offer to buy Twitter
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk, in a letter to Twitter's Chairman Bret Taylor, called his offer to buy Twitter for $43 billion his "best and final offer". Musk, who's currently the biggest shareholder of Twitter with an over 9% stake, added, "If it is not accepted, I would need to reconsider my position as a shareholder."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I once told Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "I once told industrialist Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion." Gadkari said that years ago, he had approached Tata for the inauguration of a hospital named after an RSS leader. Gadkari added, "Tata asked if the hospital was only for Hindus as it belongs to RSS...I told him discrimination doesn't happen in RSS."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: INOX Group's Siddharth Jain buys quadruplex for ₹144 crore in Mumbai: Report
text: Siddharth Jain, Executive Director of INOX Group which has businesses including industrial gases and entertainment, bought a quadruplex flat in Mumbai's Worli for ₹144 crore, according to documents accessed by IndexTap. It's an amalgamation of flats on 42nd, 43rd, 44th and 46th floors in Raheja Legend. The agreement value is ₹144 crore and the stamp duty paid is ₹7.2 crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani Green Energy becomes India's 8th most valuable company
text: Adani Green Energy has jumped two spots to become India's eighth most valued firm with a market valuation of ₹4.48 lakh crore. The company, which entered the list of top-10 valued firms on Monday, overtook Bajaj Finance and HDFC Ltd on Wednesday. Reliance Industries is India's most valued firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, HUL and SBI.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Import of cotton fully exempted from customs duties till September 30
text: The government has exempted all cotton imports from customs duties from April 14 to September 30, 2022. Currently, cotton imports attract 5% Basic Customs Duty (BCD) and 5% Agriculture Infrastructure Development Cess (AIDC). "This exemption shall benefit the textile chain - yarn, fabric, garments, and provide relief to consumers," the Finance Ministry said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: NPCI approves additional 6 crore UPI users for WhatsApp
text: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has approved an additional 6 crore users on UPI for WhatsApp. With this approval, WhatsApp will be able to expand the service to 10 crore users. The move comes months after NPCI approved increasing the user cap for WhatsApp's payment service from 2 crore to 4 crore.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: US firm's stock more than triples after fake release said Tesla acquired it
text: The shares of US-based Lithium Corp more than tripled on Wednesday after a fake press release claimed Tesla had acquired it. The shares were trading up about 25% at 1:16 pm, while Tesla shares rose 3.1% to $1,017.19. Lithium Corp issued a press release stating that it had not received "so much as an expression of interest from Tesla".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: We will review 'unsolicited' offer from Elon Musk: Twitter
text: Twitter's board will review an "unsolicited, non-binding" offer from Tesla CEO Elon Musk to acquire the social media company, Twitter said on Thursday. With a stake of over 9% in Twitter, Musk has offered to buy the remaining shares at a price of $54.2/share. We will determine the course of action that's in the best interest of shareholders, Twitter added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Emirates airline to launch NFTs for employees, customers
text: Emirates has announced that it will soon launch NFTs and "exciting experiences" in the metaverse for its customers and employees. It said that the first projects are already underway, with a launch anticipated in the coming months. Emirates' NFTs are going to be both collectible and utility-based, a statement from the firm said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China's anti-corruption watchdog involved in Jack Ma's Ant probe: Report
text: China's anti-corruption watchdog CCDI was among the agencies involved in a recent inquiry into links between billionaire Jack Ma's Ant and state-owned Chinese companies, Bloomberg News reported. It sought to understand Ant's influence and the extent of its transactions with state banks and enterprises. It was also involved in questions sent to state firms about their exposure to Ant.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Firms must recall batches of EVs that caught fire: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Wednesday said original equipment manufacturers should voluntarily recall batches of electric vehicles (EVs) involved in the recent fire accidents. Kant said the move will help in creating a sense of confidence among consumers. Adding that every transition has had its own challenges, Kant said "there's nothing to panic about" regarding the safety of EVs.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Alliance Air no longer a subsidiary of Tata Group's Air India
text: Air India on Thursday announced that Alliance Air is no longer its subsidiary. "Passengers holding tickets of Air India with a four-digit flight number starting with '9' or a three-digit flight number starting with '9I' may please be informed that these bookings belong to Alliance Air," Air India said. It added it won't handle Alliance Air-related queries from April 15.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rising tax revenue keeps us on track to becoming $5 tn economy: Govt
text: The Finance Ministry on Thursday said the government's focus on capital expenditure will boost manufacturing and tax revenue collections, thereby keeping India on track to becoming a $5 trillion economy. Tax revenues in FY22 witnessed a 33.5% rise to ₹27.07 lakh crore. The Ministry added that the government has managed to keep nominal GDP growth above 10% in recent years.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BlackRock, Mubadala to invest ₹4,000 cr in Tata Power Renewables
text: A BlackRock Real Assets-led consortium, including Mubadala Investment Company, has decided to invest ₹4,000 crore in Tata Power Renewable Energy Limited. BlackRock, together with Mubadala, shall invest by way of equity/compulsorily convertible instruments for a 10.53% stake in the renewable energy arm of Tata Power. This will translate to a base equity valuation of ₹34,000 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Infosys' employee attrition rate rises to 27.7% in Q4
text: Infosys announced on Wednesday that its employee attrition rate continued to rise during the January-March 2022 quarter, reaching 27.7%. The attrition rate in Q3 FY22 was 25.5% and in Q4 FY21 was 10.9%. Infosys' employee count increased 20.95% YoY from 2,59,619 to 3,14,015 in Q4 FY22, with a majority of them being software professionals.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jhunjhunwala sells substantial stake in Indiabulls Real Estate
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala has sold a substantial portion of his stake in Indiabulls Real Estate Limited. His name is missing from the company's key shareholder's list but the quantum of shares he has sold is not yet clear. According to Indiabulls' Q3 FY22 shareholding data, Jhunjhunwala held five million shares, or a 1.1% stake, in the real estate firm.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CBI books textiles major S Kumars in ₹1,245 crore loan fraud case
text: CBI has booked textiles major S Kumars Nationwide Limited and 14 others, including its promoters and directors, for an alleged bank fraud worth ₹1,245 crore. CBI had on Wednesday searched 13 locations related to the accused and recovered "incriminating documents", CBI spokesperson RC Joshi said. He added that promoters and directors allegedly misused bank consortium's funds between 2012 and 2018.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World Bank slashes India's FY23 GDP forecast from 8.7% to 8%
text: The World Bank cut its FY23 GDP growth forecast for India from 8.7% to 8%. "High oil and food prices caused by the war in Ukraine will have a strong negative impact on people's real incomes," said World Bank South Asia VP Hartwig Schafer. World Bank has also slashed the growth forecast for South Asia, excluding Afghanistan, to 6.6%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's trade deficit rises 35.7% YoY to $18.51 billion in March 2022
text: India's merchandise trade deficit in March 2022 rose 35.7% YoY from $13.64 billion to $18.51 billion. While merchandise exports rose 19.76% to $42.22 billion, its imports rose 24.21% to $60.74 billion, data released by the government showed. The overall trade deficit widened to $9.91 billion in March, up 93.93% YoY from $5.11 billion in March 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Planning to launch IPO in next 2-3 years: Haldiram's Chairman
text: Haldiram's is expected to enter public markets soon and the launch of its IPO is being planned in the next two-three years, the sweet and snack maker's Chairman Manohar Lal Agarwal said. Speaking on rising inflation in India, Agarwal said the company has managed to hike prices by only 10-20%. "Due to soaring inflation, almost everything is costlier," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Infosys reports ₹32,276 cr revenue in Q4, net profit at ₹5,686 cr
text: Infosys reported a 22.67% YoY rise in revenue from operations from ₹26,311 crore to ₹32,276 crore and a 12.01% rise in net profit to ₹5,686 crore in Q4 FY22. Profit in Q3 FY22 was ₹5,809 crore and revenue was ₹31,867 crore. Infosys' financial services segment witnessed the highest revenue in Q4 at ₹10,096 crore, up 16.35% from ₹8,677 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Do it like the rich do: dezerv.
text: Wealthtech firm dezerv. claims to help you invest like the ultra-wealthy have been investing for decades. Their experts aim to curate high-performing portfolios to maximize your wealth. dezerv. also offers its members exclusive access to benefits like pre-IPO deals and plans to offer global equity deals soon. It’s time to use the strategies of the ultra-wealthy for yourself, said dezerv.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Retail inflation rises to 17-month-high of 6.95% in March 2022
text: India's retail inflation jumped to a 17-month-high of 6.95% in March 2022 due to higher food and oil prices, data released by the government on Tuesday showed. This is the third consecutive month in which retail inflation has breached the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) upper margin of 6%. The country's retail inflation stood at 6.01% for February 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russia's economy set for biggest contraction since 1994: Report
text: Russia's economy is on track to contract by over 10% in 2022, said Alexei Kudrin, who served as Russia's Finance Minister from 2000 to 2011. A contraction of 10% would be the biggest decline in GDP since 1994, according to World Bank and IMF data, Reuters reported. World Bank this month forecast Russian GDP output would fall 11.2% this year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Google CEO Pichai to co-chair council to help Ukrainian refugees settle in US
text: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai will co-chair a new CEO council with over 30 CEOs to help Ukrainians and Afghans resettle in the US. "It builds on Google's long-standing support for immigrants, dreamers and refugees, and will help people through access to technology, jobs and more," Pichai said. The Welcome.US CEO council is co-chaired by Accenture CEO Julie Sweet.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'Made in India' COVID-19 vaccines better than Pfizer, Moderna: Adar Poonawalla
text: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla claimed that "Made in India" COVID-19 vaccines have provided better protection than mRNA vaccines like Pfizer and Moderna. "It's good that...vaccines like...Pfizer and Moderna aren't introduced in India," he said. "In countries like the US, people have taken 2nd and 3rd booster dose and still many are getting infected," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Requested govt to reduce COVID-19 booster gap to 6 months: Adar Poonawalla
text: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said, "We've appealed to the government on how to reduce [the gap between COVID-19 vaccine dose 2 and booster dose] to six months, will propose the six-month gap." He said, "Vaccination right now is a bit slow...because we've this rule you have to wait for nine months between dose 2 and 3."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: What an incredible answer: Paytm CEO on MEA Jaishankar's remark on Russia
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to laud the MEA S Jaishankar for his response to a reporter, who had asked, "Why not condemn Russia's invasion (of Ukraine)?" Jaishankar responded, "I prefer to do it my way and articulate it my way...We've made statements...We're against the conflict." Sharing Jaishankar's response, the Paytm CEO tweeted, "What an incredible answer."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Meta spent $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021
text: Meta spent $26.8 million on its CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021, regulatory filings revealed. Meta said, "He is synonymous with Meta and, as a result, negative sentiment regarding our company is directly associated with, and often transferred to, Zuckerberg." The 37-year-old billionaire took home a base salary of $1 last year and doesn't receive a bonus or equity awards.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I really liked it: PM Modi on graph with sound of money transacted via UPI
text: India in Pixels shared a graph with the sound of money transacted via UPI from October 2016 to March 2022 through data sonification on Twitter. PM Narendra Modi said, "I've spoken about UPI and Digital Payments quite often but I really liked how you've used the sound of money transacted...to effectively convey the point. Very interesting, impressive and obviously informative!"
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Wake-up call for industry to get its act together: Hero Electric MD on EV fires
text: Hero Electric MD Naveen Munjal told Moneycontrol the recent incidents of e-scooters catching fire are a wake-up call for the industry to get its act together. He said that issues with electric vehicles (EVs) have to be addressed by proper testing and due diligence. "You can't shortcut a lot of these things, which could lead to dangerous territory," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk sued by Twitter investor over delay in disclosing Twitter stake
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has been sued by a Twitter investor who claims Musk's delay in disclosing his ownership of over 5% of Twitter artificially kept its share price down. The delay allowed Musk to buy more shares at a lower price, the suit alleges. Musk was required to disclose his then 5% stake by March 24.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 90 SpiceJet pilots barred from flying Boeing 737 Max, will undergo re-training: DGCA
text: Indian aviation regulator DGCA has barred 90 SpiceJet pilots from operating Boeing 737 Max aircraft after finding them not properly trained. "They will have to undergo training again," said DGCA Director-General Arun Kumar. SpiceJet said the restriction does not impact the operations of Max aircraft as it still has 560 trained pilots for its fleet of 11 Max aircraft.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: India ready to supply food stock to world if WTO allows: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that during a virtual meeting with US President Joe Biden on Monday, he suggested to supply food stock to the world if the World Trade Organisation allows it. While addressing an event in Gujarat online, PM Modi added that food stock in different parts of the world is dwindling due to the Russia-Ukraine war.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: I didn't abuse my paid leave, returned to work 2 days after father's death: Nooyi
text: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi recently spoke about how she "didn't abuse" the six months of paid leave in her early career. "After my father was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer, BCG offered me six months of paid leave for his care," she said. "At the end of...three months...he died...and in three months, two days...I was back at work," she added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala sells stake in Escorts, stock price falls
text: Agriculture machinery company Escorts' share price was down over 3% on Tuesday, a day after billionaire ace investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala sold his stake in the company. Jhunjhunwala reportedly held 75 lakh equity shares, or 5.68%, in the company as of December 31. His name is now missing from the list of individual shareholders with a 1% or more stake.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian Oil removes Russian Urals from its latest tender: Report
text: Indian Oil Corp (IOC) excluded several high-sulfur crude grades, including Russian Urals, from its latest tender closing on Tuesday, Reuters reported. It reportedly informed market participants that Das, Eugene Island, Thunder Horse and Urals crude were no longer on the list of grades under its latest tender. IOC imports crude for itself and on behalf of its Chennai Petroleum subsidiary.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: If oil prices remain above $110 a barrel, burden will have to be shared: CEA
text: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said if global crude oil prices remain above $110 per barrel for more than a quarter, then the burden will have to be shared by the government, oil marketing companies and consumers. He told CNBC-TV18, "The burden needs to be shared because this is a global supply shock...It hasn't been engineered by anyone."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nokia announces its exit from Russian market over Ukraine war
text: Nokia has announced its exit from the Russian market over the Ukrainian war. "It has been clear...since the early days of the invasion of Ukraine that continuing our presence in Russia would not be possible," Nokia said. It would continue to support customers during its exit. It's applying for the relevant licences to support customers in compliance with current sanctions.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Oil India's production and drilling unaffected after cyber attack
text: Oil India Limited (OIL) PRO Tridiv Hazarika said the company's exploration and production work have not been affected in the suspected cyber attack in its field headquarters in Assam's Duliajan. The software handling functions like contractor and vendor payments is also functioning normally. OIL's Duliajan office had witnessed a cyber attack on Sunday which affected a few systems and servers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Deutsche Telekom buys $2.4 billion SoftBank stake in T-Mobile
text: Deutsche Telekom AG has bought SoftBank Group's stake in T-Mobile US for $2.4 billion. It now holds 48.4% of the company. Deutsche Telekom bought 21.2 million shares at an average price of $113 per T-Mobile share. In September last year, SoftBank agreed to swap about 45 million T-Mobile shares for a 4.5% stake in Deutsche Telekom AG.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: ED summons ex-Xiaomi India MD in foreign funding probe: Report
text: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned ex-Xiaomi India MD MK Jain to probe if the firm's business practices complied with Indian foreign exchange laws, Reuters reported citing sources. A Xiaomi spokesperson said the firm was "fully compliant with all the regulations". ED is looking into existing business structures between Xiaomi India, its contract manufacturers and its parent entity in China.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No NOC needed from housing society to sell or rent flat in Mumbai: Maha Min
text: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad said that no prior permission from housing society will be needed by owner to sell or rent out their flat in Mumbai. Mumbai is a cosmopolitan city and if a flat owner is not allowed to sell or rent their flat to a particular caste, creed and religion, it would hurt city's image, Awhad said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: US-based Halozyme to buy Antares Pharma in $960 mn all-cash deal
text: US-based Halozyme Therapeutics will buy specialty pharmaceutical firm Antares Pharma in a $960 million all-cash deal, the companies said on Wednesday. Halozyme will pay $5.6 for each share of Antares Pharma, a premium of 49.7% to the company's last closing price. "The addition of Antares...further strengthens our position as a leading drug delivery company," Halozyme CEO Helen Torley said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Oil breaches $100 mark again as China eases COVID-19 curbs
text: Oil price breached the $100 mark again on Tuesday after relaxation of COVID-19 curbs in Shanghai eased concerns about Chinese demand. Brent crude rose by $3.26 to $101.74/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose $3.01 to $97.3/barrel. Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries' warning that it would be impossible to replace potential supply losses from Russia also affected prices.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India, US to restart commercial dialogue, CEO forum: Blinken
text: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced that India and the US are restarting their bilateral commercial dialogue and the CEO's forum later this year. Blinken added that the two countries already trade to the tune of over $150 billion each year. "It can allow us to increase our collaboration across more issues including digital trade...and tax policy," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Formation of Supertech's Committee of Creditors stayed till April 19
text: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has stayed the formation of the Committee of Creditors in the Supertech insolvency case till April 19 as the real estate developer sought time to negotiate with banks. NCLAT has taken into consideration the concerns of all stakeholders, including homebuyers, said Ram Kishor Arora, the petitioner and director of the suspended board of Supertech.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: US retail inflation rose 8.5% in FY22, highest since 1981
text: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.5% in FY22, its highest level since 1981, and rose 1.2% in March 2022, the highest since 2005. Increase in prices of gasoline, food and housing contributed the most to rise in retail inflation in March. While gasoline prices rose 48% in FY22, food and housing inflation rose 8.8% and 5% respectively.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Uber hikes fare rates by 12% in Delhi-NCR amid rise in fuel prices
text: Uber has announced a 12% hike in its fares in the Delhi-NCR region owing to the surge in fuel prices. In an official statement, Uber said the move was "to help cushion drivers from the impact of a spike in fuel prices" and it will continue to track fuel prices and take further steps as needed.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's monthly Russian oil purchase less than what Europe buys in 1 afternoon: EAM
text: Amid criticism of India's purchase of oil from Russia, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said India's total monthly purchase of oil from Russia is probably less than what Europe does in an afternoon. While responding to a journalist, Jaishankar said, "I would suggest that your attention should be focused on Europe." He was speaking at the India-US 2+2 ministerial dialogue.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Let's tune out noise, stay focused: Twitter CEO as Musk turns down board seat
text: After Elon Musk turned down the offer to join Twitter's board of directors, the company's CEO Parag Agrawal told his team, "Let's tune out the noise and stay focused on the work." He added, "There will be distractions ahead but our goals and priorities remain unchanged." Musk's appointment was "contingent on a background check and formal acceptance", Agrawal said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 10% monthly growth was guaranteed: Ashneer as BharatPe CEO claims record growth
text: Former MD of BharatPe Ashneer Grover took to Twitter after CEO Suhail Sameer claimed that the company had posted record growth in the fiscal year ended March 31. Ashneer wrote, "Everyone loves March financial year ending. 10% month on month growth is guaranteed by the calendar; 31/28 days!" Suhail shared a LinkedIn post about the company's growth on Monday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk may buy more shares in Twitter, express views on social media: Filing
text: World's richest person and Twitter's largest shareholder Elon Musk has updated a regulatory filing regarding his stake in Twitter after rejecting the offer to join its board. As per the filing, Musk may acquire additional shares in Twitter and may express his views through social media. He was earlier limited from owning over 14.9% stake in Twitter as board member.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jeff Bezos responds to Musk's poll to turn Twitter HQ into a homeless shelter
text: Jeff Bezos, Amazon Founder and the world's second-richest person, responded to a poll by the world's richest man, Elon Musk, on whether Twitter's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. "Or do portion. Worked out great and makes it easy for employees who want to volunteer," Bezos tweeted to Musk. Elon Musk responded "Great idea" to Bezos.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: TCS hires record 1,03,546 employees in 2021-22
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Monday said that it made a record hiring by adding 1,03,546 employees in the financial year ending March 2022. "In Q4, TCS added 35,209 employees on a net basis, the highest ever net addition in a quarter," TCS further noted. It added that IT services attrition continued to climb and reached 17.4% during the quarter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk tweets emoji with hand on mouth after Twitter CEO says he won't join Board
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a laughing emoji with hand on mouth on Twitter about an hour after Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Musk has decided not to join its Board. Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, later deleted the tweet. Agrawal said that Twitter will value input from its shareholders, whether or not they are on the Board.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: TRAI releases recommendations for 5G auction; shares reserve price
text: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) on Monday released recommendations on the 'Auction of spectrum in frequency bands identified for IMT/5G'. It recommended a significant cut in the reserve price for the 5G spectrum. "Telecom Service Providers should be allowed easy payment options including part payment with the flexibility of moratorium," TRAI recommended.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter did right by its staff: Executive on Musk not joining firm's board
text: Twitter's Director of ML Ethics, Transparency, and Accountability Rumman Chowdhury responded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk not joining Twitter's board saying the firm did right by its employees. "Musk's immediate chilling effect was something that bothered me significantly," she said. "People like him thrive on attention...I am glad to have joined a company that...is responsive," Chowdhury added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Chennai software firm gifts cars to 100 employees for 5 years of service
text: Chennai-based software firm Ideas2IT on Monday gifted Maruti Suzuki cars to 100 employees who have worked for five years at the company. The decision of gifting cars was collectively decided by the employees, Murali Vivekanandan, who founded Ideas2IT in 2009, told Moneycontrol. "This (car) is what they have done. And, not for what they are going to do," Vivekanandan added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I am serious: Musk on poll to turn Twitter headquarters into homeless shelter
text: Elon Musk, the world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, tweeted, "I'm serious about this", about a poll to turn Twitter headquarters in San Francisco into a homeless shelter. At the time of writing, over 91% of the respondents had voted in favour of turning the Twitter headquarters into a homeless shelter. Musk was recently named to Twitter's board.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: TCS' attrition rate continues to rise, hits 17.4% in January-March
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) announced that its employee attrition rate continued to rise during the January-March quarter, reaching 17.4%. "The reported attrition number of 17.4% will get worse for the next couple of quarters just because of the way LTM attrition is calculated," CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said. "But...on a month-on-month basis...we're starting to see flattening of it," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ola CEO to step back from daily ops to focus on engineering functions: Report
text: Ola Founder and CEO Bhavish Aggarwal will step back from day-to-day operations to focus his attention on engineering functions, team building, and products, as per an internal note accessed by Moneycontrol. Aggarwal mentioned in that note that group CFO GR Arun Kumar will be helping him drive the day-to-day operations across the group. Kumar joined Ola in May last year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Lenskart raises $100 million in funding, valuation crosses $4 billion
text: Peyush Bansal-led Lenskart has raised ₹760 crore ($100 million) in the latest funding round, revealed the company’s regulatory filings. While the round was raised from Alpha Wave Incubation, previously known as Falcon Edge, a report said that post this round, Lenskart is valued at $4.3 billion. The Softbank-backed company has raised over $900 million since its inception in 2010.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indian husband-wife, who each have unicorn startups, plan first startup IPO
text: Indian husband-wife Ruchi Kalra and Asish Mohapatra, who each built their own billion-dollar startups OfBusiness and Oxyzo Financial Services, are planning their first IPO. OfBusiness, a supplier of raw materials to small businesses, could go for an IPO in six months to a year, Co-founder Kalra said. The couple's other unicorn Oxyzo could float shares in two years, she added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nirav Modi's close aide Subhash Shankar brought to India from Egypt: Reports
text: The CBI has deported Subhash Shankar Parab, a close aide of fugitive jeweller Nirav Modi, from Egypt and has brought him to Mumbai, said CBI officials. Parab had reportedly fled to Cairo in 2018 and was absconding ever since the ₹7,000 crore bank fraud case against Nirav came to light. He was the Deputy General Manager (Finance) at Firestar Diamond.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: India's consumption of petroleum products hits 3-year high in March
text: The total petroleum product consumption in March stood at 19.41 million tonnes, the highest since March 2019, according to the latest data from the Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell of the Oil Ministry. Diesel, the most used fuel in the country, saw the demand rising by 6.7% to 7.7 million tonnes. Petrol sales were up 6.1% at 2.91 million tonnes.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Pakistan stocks jump the most since 2020 after Imran Khan removed as PM
text: Pakistan stocks have rallied after former cricketer Imran Khan was removed as Prime Minister, raising hopes that the election of Shehbaz Sharif as the next Prime Minister would bring political stability to the country. The KSE-100 (Karachi Stock Exchange) jumped 3.4%, the most since November 2020. Furthermore, Pakistan's currency climbed to the highest level since March 30.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Every second you protest we're losing dollars: SL PM to people amid economic crisis
text: Amid widespread protests in Sri Lanka over the worst economic crisis the country has seen since Independence, PM Mahinda Rajapaksa appealed to the people to end protests. Saying that the government is working round-the-clock to resolve the crisis, Rajapaksa said, "Every second you protest on the roads, we are losing dollars."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Putin earns $1 billion a day from oil alone: Zelenskyy's economic adviser
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin "earns $1 billion a day from oil alone", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's economic adviser, Oleg Ustenko, said. Ustenko urged countries to impose an embargo on Russian oil's transportation. "Some European nations are concerned...[about] inflation...However, the market will undergo a rapid correction, and prices will return to acceptable levels," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani Green becomes India's 10th most valued firm with ₹4.22 lakh crore m-cap
text: Adani Green Energy has surpassed Bharti Airtel to become the 10th most valuable company in India. The company's shares surged 20% on Monday to hit an all-time high of ₹2,786.20 on NSE. Its market capitalisation now stands at ₹4.22 lakh crore. Earlier this month, Adani Group became India's third conglomerate to cross a market capitalisation of $200 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Which platform can ever pull this off?: Paytm CEO on Bezos-Musk Twitter exchange
text: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's idea of starting a homeless shelter at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters. Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma reacted to the exchange and said, "Jeff joins Elon on Twitter. Which platform in the world can ever pull this off?" Bezos said a portion of the headquarters can be converted.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: German robotics firm to buy SoftBank's humanoid Pepper robot-maker
text: Germany's United Robotics Group will acquire SoftBank's Paris-based robotics unit SoftBank Robotics Europe, which developed the humanoid Pepper robot. SoftBank Robotics Europe will revert to its former name Aldebaran. SoftBank will acquire a minority stake in URG and the two companies will cooperate in marketing robots. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: You’ll get Twitter verification back, even if you shorted Tesla: Musk to investor
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded after American investor Michael Burry, who was portrayed in the movie 'The Big Short', said he was no longer a verified user on Twitter. "You will get it back, even though you shorted Tesla," Musk, the largest shareholder of Twitter, said. Burry ditched his bearish bets against Musk-led Tesla last year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Oil prices drop below $100 mark on China lockdown, release of reserves
text: Oil prices dropped below the $100 mark on Monday on plans to release record volumes of crude and oil products and on continuing lockdowns in China. Brent crude slipped $3.93 to $98.85/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.19 to $94.07/barrel. The International Energy Agency member nations, along with the US, will release 240 million barrels within six months.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: TCS records ₹50,591 crore revenue in Q4, net profit at ₹9,926 crore
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) revenue in Q4 FY22 grew 15.8% YoY to ₹50,591 crore, crossing the ₹50,000 crore mark for the first time. Its total revenue in FY22 stood at ₹1,91,754 crore, up 16.8% YoY. The company recorded net profit of ₹9,926 crore in Q4, a rise of 7.4% YoY from ₹9,246 crore in Q4 FY21.
author: Ashley Paul
